title: Papua New Guinea Food Inflation
description: Cost of food in Papua New Guinea increased 5.10 percent in June of 2022 over the same month in the previous year. Food Inflation in Papua New Guinea averaged 4.17 percent from 1978 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 23.73 percent in the first quarter of 2003 and a record low of -90.40 percent in the fourth quarter of 2010. This page provides the latest reported value for - Papua New Guinea Food Inflation - plus previous releases, historical high and low, short-term forecast and long-term prediction, economic calendar, survey consensus and news.
author: Bank of Papua New Guinea
